oneLine.s76: This is almost a <h>perfect line</h>. It works without effort.
oneLine.s74: Top-tier chemistry. <h>The more you're together, the easier it gets</h>.
oneLine.s70: Baseline fit is good. <h>Conflicts don't drag on</h>.
oneLine.s66: You match fairly well. <h>Low burden even when together</h>.
oneLine.s62: A decent pair. <h>If you tune the pace gap</h>, it gets better.
oneLine.s58: Not bad, but <h>the vibe differs a bit</h>.
oneLine.s46: During conversation, <h>question marks may appear often</h>.
oneLine.s44: Sometimes you may think <h>'Why are we this different?'</h>.
oneLine.s42: If left alone, there's a high chance you'll <h>just talk past each other</h>.
oneLine.base: To be blunt, this is a <h>high-collision pair</h>.

withFn.0: Your common ground is {fn}. If you align the point, you get close quickly.
withFn.1: You build trust quickly because {fn} alignment is strong.

withoutFn.0: Common ground is relatively thin, so early on you need time to decode each other.
withoutFn.1: At first the texture may feel different, but it can get easier once patterns emerge.

noClash.0: {scene}. More than big collisions, aligning pace and priority is enough.
noClash.1: {scene}. The same words can land differently, so interpretation checks are important.

high.0: {scene}. Even if approaches differ on {axis}, it can complement well.
high.1: {scene}. Around {axis}, role split helps it run like teamwork.

low.0: {scene}. Around {axis}, different kindness standards can easily create hurt feelings.
low.1: {scene}. On {axis}, one side may want conclusion while the other wants understanding.

mid.0: {scene}. Around {axis}, methods split. If assumptions align before conclusion, conflict drops.
mid.1: {scene}. Coordination on {axis} is the key. One extra sentence changes the feeling.

page.title: How is chemistry score calculated?
page.intro1: Moimrank does not compare only the four MBTI letters. Instead, we compare how each type's
page.intro2: In short, we look at whether the way people observe, think, and decide connects smoothly.

section1.title: What are cognitive functions?
section1.lead: People differ in how they process information and make decisions.

bullets.0: ‚úî Some people first notice possibilities and ideas.
bullets.1: ‚úî Some people first notice facts and details.
bullets.2: ‚úî Some people judge by logic and efficiency.
bullets.3: ‚úî Some people prioritize values and emotions.

section1.tail: These baseline thinking patterns are called cognitive functions.

0.title: 1) Do the dominant styles collide?
0.body: If both strongly push the same standard, decisions can be fast, but control conflicts may grow.

1.title: 2) Do they complement each other?
1.body: When one person's strength fills the other's weak spot, conversation tends to flow naturally.

2.title: 3) Is their direction similar?
2.body: We check whether both focus on big-picture meaning, practical reality, or a balanced mix.

3.title: 4) Do sensitive triggers overlap?
3.body: If stress triggers are similar, the chance of friction can increase.

section3.title: Why scores differ
section3.lead: The score is not a simple same-or-different personality check.

bullets.3: ‚úî Are pace and standards far apart?

section3.tail: We combine these factors. That is why even the same MBTI pairing can feel different by context.

0.label: Best Match
0.body: Strengths connect well and conversation flows with little effort.

2.label: Mixed
2.body: It can feel different depending on the situation.

3.label: Needs Tuning
3.body: It can improve when both sides actively coordinate.

4.label: Critical
4.body: Thinking styles can collide often. Distance control and role clarity become important.

section5.title: Please remember
section5.p1: This result is for understanding communication and collaboration better, not for judging people.
section5.p2: A low score does not mean someone is a bad match. It means misunderstandings are more likely if the current pattern stays unchanged.

page.title: Frequently Asked Questions
page.intro1: Moimrank is a tool for "fun + understanding". We gathered common questions about chemistry scores/types, role suggestions, and interpretation in one place.
page.intro2Highlight: it shows whether people's thinking styles connect naturally

item1.title: Q. What exactly does Moimrank do?
item1.p1: Based on members' MBTI, Moimrank organizes the relationship graph, chemistry scores, and role suggestions in an easy-to-read way.

bullets.one: ‚úî Who matches well with whom (chemistry ranking)
bullets.two: ‚úî What kind of group flow you have (summary/type)
bullets.three: ‚úî Who is likely strong at which role (role suggestion)

item2.title: Q. Is chemistry score based only on matching the 4 MBTI letters?
item2.p1: No. It does not only compare letters like E/I or N/S. It also references cognitive function combinations (thinking habits).
item2.p2: So even with the same MBTI, the experience can feel different by topic, situation, and role.

item3.title: Q. If the chemistry score is high, are we automatically best friends?
item3.p1: Not necessarily. The score is closer to "a combination with fewer conflicts and smoother flow" and is not a direct measure of closeness or preference.
item3.p2: Even with a low score, groups can work very well if communication rules, roles, and tone are adjusted.

item4.title: Q. What determines top/worst pairs in chemistry ranking?
item4.p1: All member pairs in the group are generated, then ranked by score. As member count grows, combinations and rankings become richer.
item4.p2: "Worst" is not blame. It means a pair that may require more coordination points.

item5.title: Q. What do chemistry types (Stable/Complement/Spark/Explosive) mean?
item5.stable: üåä Stable ‚Äî Comfortable and sustainable when pace is aligned
item5.complement: üß© Complement ‚Äî Efficiency rises a lot when roles are divided well
item5.spark: ‚ö° Spark ‚Äî Fast and exciting, but assumptions/tone can cause misunderstanding
item5.explosive: üß® Explosive ‚Äî On tiring days, emotional cost can grow without conversation rules
item5.p2: Moimrank shows representative pairs by type using scores, so you can quickly see which patterns are common in your group.

item6.title: Q. How are group role suggestions decided?
item6.p1: Using members' MBTI, role tendencies such as strategy, vibe, execution, organization, and mediation are estimated with simple rules.
item6.p2: It is less about "this person must do this role" and more about who can naturally take each role in this specific group.

item7.title: Q. What if some members don't enter MBTI?
item7.p1: Without MBTI, some analyses (chemistry score/type, distribution) are limited. Chemistry ranking and type classification work when at least two members enter MBTI.

item8.title: Q. Can I change results if I don't like them?
item8.p1: If MBTI is edited, results are recalculated immediately. Also, groups are shaped by people + context, so treat results as reference.
item8.p2: In many cases, the ambiguous score zone improves a lot once simple conversation rules are set.

item9.title: Q. Is personal information safe?
item9.p1: Moimrank is designed to work with minimal inputs and recommends using only nickname and MBTI for analysis.
item9.p2: We recommend not entering sensitive information such as real name or contact details.

item10.title: Q. Are these scores/types the final truth?
item10.p1: No. The goal is not to judge people, but to quickly identify points that may create misunderstandings and points that help collaboration flow.
item10.p2: Even with lower scores, teams can improve a lot by aligning conversation pace, decision criteria, and tone.

page.title: Privacy Policy
page.intro: Moimrank (the ‚ÄúService‚Äù) values your privacy and complies with applicable laws. This policy explains what information is collected and used during service use, and what rights users have.

section1.title: 1. Personal information we collect
section1.p1: The Service collects only the minimum information required to provide core features.

required.label: Required (service operation)
required.body: Nickname, MBTI, and group participation identifiers (invite link/group ID and related IDs)

logs.label: Automatically collected (logs)
logs.body: Access records, IP address, browser/device information, cookies, visit/use records (including error logs)

section1.noticeBody: The Service does not intentionally collect unnecessary data such as national ID numbers or sensitive personal data (health, politics, religion, etc.). Please do not enter such data.

section2.title: 2. Purpose of collection and use
section2.item1: Provide core features such as group creation/join, relationship graph, and chemistry reports
section2.item2: User identification, abuse prevention, and service stability
section2.item3: Respond to inquiries and deliver notices (when contact information is provided)
section2.item4: Service improvement and statistical analysis (anonymized/pseudonymized or aggregated)
section2.item5: Ad exposure and performance measurement (if AdSense/affiliate programs are introduced)

section3.title: 3. Retention and use period
section3.p1Prefix: As a rule, personal information is
section3.p1Strong: deleted without delay once the purpose is fulfilled
section3.p1Suffix: . However, when retention is required by law, data may be retained for the legally required period.
section3.item1: Group/member data: retained during service use or until user deletion request
section3.item2: Access/error logs: retained for a limited period for security/stability, then deleted

section4.title: 4. Sharing with third parties
section4.p1: In principle, the Service does not provide personal information to third parties. Exceptions apply only when required by law or when users have given prior consent.
section4.adBoxPrefix: In the future, external ad/affiliate programs such as Google AdSense or Coupang Partners may be added. In that case, cookies or ad identifiers may be used for

section5.title: 5. Outsourcing of processing
section5.p1: To operate the Service stably, some tasks may be outsourced to third-party vendors. When outsourcing, contracts and oversight for personal data protection are applied.
section5.item1: Example hosting/infrastructure: Vercel, Cloudflare, DB providers
section5.item3: Example ads: Google AdSense, Coupang Partners (if introduced)

section6.title: 6. Cookies and online identifiers
section6.p1: The Service may use cookies and similar technologies to provide a better experience and to measure analytics/ad performance.
section6.item2: Analytics cookies: visit/use statistics and error analysis
section6.item3: Advertising cookies: personalized ads and performance measurement (if introduced)
section6.p2: Users can refuse or delete cookies in browser settings. Some features may be limited as a result.

section7.title: 7. User rights and how to exercise them
section7.p1: Users may request access, correction, deletion, and suspension of processing of their personal information at any time.
section7.item1: If supported in-product: process directly in settings/management menu
section7.item2: Otherwise: request through the operator contact channel
section7.p2: Identity verification may be required, and immediate deletion can be restricted when legal retention obligations apply.

section8.title: 8. Deletion procedure and method
section8.p1: When the retention period expires or processing purpose is achieved, data is deleted without delay.
section8.item1: Electronic files: permanently deleted using non-recoverable methods

section9.title: 9. Protection measures
section9.item1: Minimization of access permissions and access control
section9.item3: Encryption where applicable and secure transport (HTTPS)

section10.title: 10. Children's personal information
section10.p1: The Service does not separately collect children‚Äôs personal information. Where guardian consent is required, relevant laws are followed.

section11.title: 11. Changes to this policy
section11.p1: If this Privacy Policy changes, we will provide prior notice through in-service announcements. Important changes may require additional consent procedures.

page.title: Terms of Service
page.introPrefix: These Terms govern rights, obligations, and responsibilities between users and the operator regarding use of the

section1.title: 1. Service overview
section1.p1: Based on MBTI inputs from group members, Moimrank provides relationship/chemistry scores, rankings, distribution, and role suggestions as reference information for fun.
section1.p2: Service results are not intended to define or judge a person‚Äôs character, relationships, or abilities, and should not be used as the sole basis for real-life decisions.

section2.title: 2. User obligations
section2.item1: Do not use content/nicknames that defame others or cause offense.
section2.item2: Do not interfere with service operation (e.g., excessive requests, automated abuse).
section2.item3: The operator is not responsible for disputes/damages caused by false input.

section3.title: 3. Advertising and affiliate notice
section3.p1: To operate the Service, Moimrank may include advertising (e.g., Google AdSense) or affiliate links (e.g., Coupang Partners).
section3.noticeBody: This page may include affiliate links. If a user purchases through those links, the operator may receive a commission.
section3.p2Suffix: may be prohibited. Users must not click ads for ‚Äúsupport purposes‚Äù or request/induce such clicks.

section4.title: 4. External links and third-party services
section4.p1: The Service may contain links to websites/services provided by third parties. Content, products/services, policies, and transactions on external links are the provider‚Äôs responsibility, and the operator does not guarantee or assume liability for them.

section5.title: 5. Intellectual property
section5.p1: Rights to all content in the Service, including UI, text, structure, and logos, belong to the operator or rightful owners. Users may not reproduce/distribute/create derivatives beyond permitted use.

section6.title: 6. Service changes and suspension
section6.p1: The operator may change or suspend part/all of the Service for quality improvements, policy changes, or technical needs. Important changes will be announced in a reasonable way.

section7.title: 7. Disclaimer and limitation of liability
section7.item1: Service results are for reference only and are not guaranteed for accuracy/fitness.
section7.item2: Disputes between users, group conflicts, and decision outcomes are users‚Äô responsibility.
section7.item3: The operator is not liable for damages caused by force majeure such as natural disasters, network failures, or third-party outages.

section8.title: 8. Privacy and inquiries
section8.p1Prefix: Information about personal data processing is provided in the
section8.p1Suffix: . Inquiries can be submitted through the contact channel announced in the Service.

section9.title: 9. Governing law and jurisdiction
section9.p1: These Terms are governed by the laws of the Republic of Korea, and disputes related to service use are brought before courts with jurisdiction under applicable civil procedure law.

client.saveGuide: Press save to store {center} as the baseline in recent groups.

invite.shareText: Join the group with this link.

empty.oneMember: There is no chemistry pair yet because only one member is present. Add one more member to view rankings.
empty.needMbti: There are no comparable pairs yet. (Chemistry is calculated when at least 2 MBTI entries exist.)

chemReport.emptyNeedMembers: At least 2 members with MBTI are needed to view rankings.
chemReport.noneType: No pairs are classified as this type yet.

comments.stable: If conversation tempo aligns, these pairs stay comfortable for long.
comments.complement: With clear role split, the group runs like a team play.
comments.spark: Fast bonding, but assumptions may clash at times.
comments.explode: On rough days, tone alone can split the mood.

profiles.explodeHigh: This group needs clearer alignment to prevent misunderstandings.
profiles.sparkHigh: High energy and quick bonding, with periodic tuning needed.
profiles.stableHigh: Many comfortable long-term pairings make this group stable.
profiles.complementHigh: Members tend to fill each other's gaps well.
profiles.mixed: This group shows mixed chemistry depending on the situation.

groupPage.rolesSubtitle: Who is strong in which role
groupPage.footerNote: This result is for reference and fun. Do not use it as the basis for relationship decisions.
groupPage.graphLoadingDesc: Preparing the graph first. You can already view the content above.
groupPage.distributionEmpty: No MBTI has been entered yet. Even one entry starts the distribution.
groupPage.rolesEmpty: When MBTI is entered, the system automatically identifies which roles are strong in this group.

distribution.balanceOne: Neither side dominates, so the tone shifts naturally by situation.

ei.E: Conversation flows naturally and gets lively quickly.
ei.I: It is quieter, but when they speak, they are very concise.

ns.N: Discussion extends well from one topic to another idea.
ns.S: Even if talk drifts, it tends to return to execution.

tf.T: The flow is to organize and think first, then check emotions.
tf.F: Before conclusion, people first share how they feel.

jp.J: Someone naturally organizes and closes the flow.
jp.P: Conclusions stay open and the group adjusts while trying.

ei.tie: Speak when needed, rest when needed.

ns.offTopic: Even if talk drifts, it returns to

jp.openClose: stays open and closes when needed.
jp.organizerAppears: naturally appears and closes the meeting.

caution.noBigDownside: There is no major downside, and
caution.clearTopic: it works better when the topic is clear.

desc.STRATEGY: Tends to see big patterns first. Strong at setting direction and designing structure.
desc.VIBE: Tends to read the room and connect conversations well. Strong at easing awkward moments.
desc.EXEC: Tends to move quickly with a try-first approach. Strong at driving momentum.
desc.ORGANIZE: Tends to organize priorities and conclusions well. Strong at wrapping up discussions.
desc.MEDIATOR: Tends to smooth differences in viewpoints. Strong at reducing friction.

empty.STRATEGY: Without someone setting direction, meetings can run long.
empty.VIBE: Without someone shaping atmosphere, conversations can become stiff.
empty.EXEC: Without someone pushing execution, ideas can stall.
empty.ORGANIZE: Without an organize/decision role, conclusions may be delayed.
empty.MEDIATOR: Without a mediator, small misunderstandings can last longer.

headline.noMembers: As more members join, role tendencies become clearer.
headline.noDistribution: Role distribution is still thin. More MBTI inputs are needed.
headline.default: This group is strong in {mainRole}, and also has strength in {secondaryRole}.

tip.default: Roles are not fixed. It is natural for them to change by situation.
tip.lack: Caution: {role} is currently missing. Without someone in this role, meetings can run long.

bottomCta.historyHint: When you create or join a group, it will appear here.
